document_title: Interstitial cystitis: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
According to information from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), interstitial cystitis is a disease that can occur in people of all ages. also said that for every 100,000 people, 5.1 people will suffer from interstitial cystitis. (3)
The disease occurs most commonly between the ages of 20-40 years old. White people and women are believed to be more susceptible to interstitial cystitis than others. For women, due to the biological structure of the urethra, they are at greater risk of the disease than men with a ratio of 9/1. However, interstitial cystitis in women often leaves early clinical signs that help them detect and treat the disease promptly. Limit complications of the disease.
The US National Institutes of Health NIDDK also offers some notes to help you limit the risk of interstitial cystitis:
Pay attention to genital hygiene to prevent urinary tract infections; Avoid holding urine or holding urine for too long; Avoid wearing clothes and underwear that are too tight; Make sure the ingredients in cleaning solutions and laundry detergent are not harmful to health; Avoid taking medication spontaneously, not as prescribed by your doctor. Especially pain relievers, antidepressants and contraceptives
